questions.question: 1. In the decades before the American Revolution, the English colonial westward movement

choices.answer: a. resulted in cultural blending with American Indians.
b. disrupted the existing French–Indian fur trade.
c. reinforced the existing national identity of settlers.
d. introduced guns, horses to Indian tribes on the frontier.

questions.question: 2. The Proc of 1763 prohibiting  migration w of the App Mts resulted from all of these EXCEPT

choices.answer: Ongoing Indian uprisings such as Pontiac’s Rebellion.
Parliament’s desire to punish colonies for smuggling
British weariness to engage in further military conflicts.
British determination to reduce $$$ after the 7 Years’ War.

questions.question: Why did Indian tribes try to form alliances w other tribes &Eur countries mid- and late 1700s?

choices.answer: They wanted to gain access to European trade goods.
They wanted to limit the movement of white settlers.
They wanted to be able to sell tribal lands more easily.
They wanted to become a single, unified tribe.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT correctly identified?

choices.answer: Quebec Act—granted freedom of worship to Catholics in Quebec
Townshend Acts—placed “external” tax on tea, glass,paper
Quartering Act—req colonies to house,feed British soldiers
Declaratory Act—reasserted supremacy of king over colonies

questions.question: Which of these contributed  LEAST to growing col sentiment toward independence in the 1770s?

choices.answer: Anger over effort to tax colonists & their  lack of rep in P
British refusal to send troops to protect from Indians
Emerging ideology of resistance based on Enlightenment
Growing sense of American identity & grassroots movements

questions.question: Despite GB’s military, industry, population, col's won the war bc they had all of these EXCEPT

choices.answer: greater familiarity with the land.
superior political leadership.
overwhelming popular support.
a deep ideological commitment.

questions.question: Which of these is properly matched?

choices.answer: Treaty of Greenville— US free nav on Miss,right of dep in NO
Jay’s Treaty—Brits abandon forts in NW, averting war w GB
Neutral Proc of 93—Indianc cede present-day IN & OH to US
Pinckney’s Treaty—US refusal to get involv in Euro conflict

questions.question: The XYZ Affair, Sedition Act, and Convention of 1800

choices.answer: Reinforced US isolationism and non-involve in Euro affairs
Convinced Jeffersonians that Feds wanted for war w France.
Led to debate on interpret of Const, balancing power in gov.
Demonstrated challenges US faced as result of the French Rev

questions.question: Alien & Sedition Acts did all of these EXCEPT

choices.answer: Ease popular fears of an imminent war with France
Prompt Jeffer. & Madison to author VA &  and KY Resolutions
Give pres. power:deport “dangerous” for's, prosecute critics
create a cons. crisis & backlash that led to election of TJ

questions.question: Which of the following Enlightenment thinkers is correctly matched?

choices.answer: John Locke—natural rights
Jean-Jacques Rousseau—separation of powers
Baron de Montesquieu—free trade
Adam Smith—social contract

questions.question: Thomas Paine’s Common Sense was seen as

choices.answer: Written in response to the Declaration of Independence
A widely read criticism of  Brit rule of the colonies.
Responsible for KG III's formal declar colonies in rebellion
too radical by many of the founding fathers.

questions.question: The Articles of Confederation suffered from all of these EXCEPT

choices.answer: Requiring 2/3 majority vote to pass legislation
Lacking an exec branch and fed court system.
Disallowing direct taxation of the states or individuals.
Prohibiting amendments to the original articles.

questions.question: Which of these prompted calls for a new, stronger central government under the Articles of Con?

choices.answer: The Stono Rebellion
The Whiskey Rebellion
Shays’ Rebellion
The Regulator uprisings

questions.question: Which of these at the const con was LEAST likely the result of regional & sectional difference?

choices.answer: 3/5 Compromise,  5 slaves = 3 whites for rep in H of R
Slave Trade Comp, Congr can't limit,ban  slave trade til '07
Great Compromise, which provided for a bicameral legislature
Exec Elections Compromise, which created  Electoral College.

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a provision of Hamilton’s financial plan?

choices.answer: Taxing the states to pay off the war debt
Paying the full amount owed on confederation bonds
Placing an excise tax on whiskey
Creating a national bank

questions.question: Who famously admonished her husband to “remember the ladies”?

choices.answer: Deborah Sampson
Molly Pitcher
Abigail Adams
Phillis Wheatley

questions.question: After ratification, constitutional compromises remained the most controversial in which area?

choices.answer: Separation of powers
Slavery
Congressional representation
Taxation

questions.question: Which of the following was an outcome of the American Revolution?

choices.answer: Generated new spirit of equality, improving Indian relations
Halted the westward movement of settlers for a generation.
It inspired a number of other independence movements.
Condemned overseas for protecting interests of col. elites.

questions.question: Which of these groups of immigrants heavily settled along the west frontier of PA, MD, and VA?

choices.answer: Dutch immigrants
Welsh immigrants
Scots-Irish immigrants
German immigrants

questions.question: During the second half of the 1700s, the Spanish

choices.answer: Stopped forced Indian labor b/c new Spanish immigration
Abandoned their missions in CA due to  Indian uprisings
Class system prevented social mobility for Spanish settlers.
Settlements provided for significant cultural blending

questions.question: The Northwest Ordinance of 1787 did all of these EXCEPT

choices.answer: Create a process for territories to  gain statehood
Set aside large reservations for Indian tribes in the area,
Guaranteed a generation of peaceful relations w Am Indians.
Survey of lands & require towns set aside land for school.

questions.question: In the 1790s, the US successfully negotiated free navigation of the Mississippi River with

choices.answer: Spain
France
England
the Barbary pirates.

questions.question: The Democratic-Republicans favored

choices.answer: Protective tariffs
Closer relations with England.
States’ rights
A national bank.

questions.question: In which area did the Federalists and Democratic-Republicans most agree?

choices.answer: Foreign policy
Constitutional interpretation
Economics
Indian policy

questions.question: Which of these most led to growing regional differences over slavery in the late 1700s?

choices.answer: The rise of radical abolitionist movement in New England
Election of Southern slave-owning presidents (GW,TJ, JM,JM)
The new cotton gin,  which increased the profits of cotton
Harsh measures used in South to suppress  slave revolts.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes “republican motherhood”?

choices.answer: It glorified femininity and the woman’s role in the house.
Encouraged women to instill virtue, civic value in sons
It promoted the notion of separate spheres for men & women.
Led middle class women to demand greater equality
